column1: Bulging of one eye, especially in a child, is a very serious sign.
Hyperthyroidism (particularly Graves disease) is the most common cause of bulging eyes.

Causes may include: - Glaucoma - Graves disease - Hemangioma - Histiocytosis - Hyperthyroidism - Hyperthyroidism caused by medications for other conditions - Leukemia - Neuroblastoma - Orbital cellulitis or periorbital cellulitis - Rhabdomyosarcoma
Call your health care provider if: - You have bulging eyes and the cause has not yet been diagnosed.
- Bulging eyes are accompanied by other symptoms.
